commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task Class with mark and unmark
Add Different Task Types: Todo, Deadline, Event
Add Semi-automated Testing by Using the I/O Redirection Technique
Add Local Date and Time to deadlines
Add Local Date and Time to deadlines
Put all classes into faye package
Remove lines and Set up Gradle
Complete GUI tutorial part3 -- Add interactive features
Complete GUI tutorial part4 -- Implement FXML
Add assertions to document key internal invariants
commitResults.messageBody:
Added Java assert statements in core classes to document and
enforce important assumptions that should always hold during
program execution.

Assertions were introduced in the following areas:
- Task: ensure description is never null
- Deadline: ensure due date is never null
- Event: ensure time range (from, to) is never null
- TaskList: ensure internal task list and added tasks are not null
- Storage: ensure task list passed for saving is not null

These assertions guard against programming errors and make
implicit assumptions explicit. They are used only for internal
logic validation and not for validating user input.

This improves code robustness and makes debugging easier by
failing fast when invariants are violated.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor core classes for Code Qquality
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactored key classes to improve code readability, maintainability, and to enforce consistent behavior:

Parser.java
-Removed merge conflict markers and redundant comments
-Introduced constants (SPACE_DELIMITER, DEADLINE_SPLITTER, EVENT_SPLITTER) for clarity and reuse

Storage.java
-Added a default branch in task type switch to skip malformed or unknown lines
-Introduced constants (STORAGE_DELIMITER, TASK_TYPE_TODO, TASK_TYPE_DEADLINE, TASK_TYPE_EVENT, DONE_MARKER) to reduce magic strings

TaskList.java
-Fixed indentation issue in find() to ensure proper task collection

Ui.java
-Reduced code duplication between showAdd() and showDelete() via showTaskUpdate()

Faye.java

Simplified run() method and extracted command handling into handleCommand() and dedicated handlers (handleList(), handleMark(), etc.)

Introduced helper methods (saveTasks(), addTaskAndNotify()) to reduce duplication

Added constants for file path, date format, and command strings

Improved variable naming for clarity (deadlineParts, eventParts, description)

Updated exception handling (throws Exception for handleCommand, throws EmptyTaskInputException for handleTodo)

These changes improve code structure, readability, and maintainability, making future modifications and debugging easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor TaskList, Ui, and Storage using Java Streams
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactored key methods to leverage Java Streams for cleaner and more concise code:

Changes include:
TaskList.find(String keyword)
-Replaced manual loop with stream: tasks.stream().filter(task -> task.getTask().contains(keyword)).collect(Collectors.toCollection(ArrayList::new))
-Added import: java.util.stream.Collectors
Ui.showTasks(ArrayList<Task> tasks)
-Replaced for-loop with IntStream: IntStream.range(0, tasks.size()).forEach(i -> System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + tasks.get(i)))
-Added import: java.util.stream.IntStream
Storage.save(ArrayList<Task> tasks)
-Replaced for-each loop with stream: tasks.stream().map(Task::toStorageString).forEach(line -> writeLine(fw, line))
-Added private helper writeLine(FileWriter fw, String line) that wraps IOException in UncheckedIOException for use in streams
-Added import: java.io.UncheckedIOException

These changes simplify iteration, reduce boilerplate, and improve readability by using functional-style constructs.
Add assertions to document key internal invariants

Refactored key classes to improve code readability, maintainability, and to enforce consistent behavior:

Changes include:

Parser.java

Removed merge conflict markers and redundant comments

Introduced constants (SPACE_DELIMITER, DEADLINE_SPLITTER, EVENT_SPLITTER) for clarity and reuse

Added a default branch in task type switch to skip malformed or unknown lines

Introduced constants (STORAGE_DELIMITER, TASK_TYPE_TODO, TASK_TYPE_DEADLINE, TASK_TYPE_EVENT, DONE_MARKER) to reduce magic strings

TaskList.java

Fixed indentation issue in find() to ensure proper task collection

Faye.java

Simplified run() method and extracted command handling into handleCommand() and dedicated handlers (handleList(), handleMark(), etc.)

Introduced helper methods (saveTasks(), addTaskAndNotify()) to reduce duplication

Added constants for file path, date format, and command strings

Improved variable naming for clarity (deadlineParts, eventParts, description)

Updated exception handling (throws Exception for handleCommand, throws EmptyTaskInputException for handleTodo)

Ui.java

Reduced code duplication between showAdd() and showDelete() via showTaskUpdate()

These changes improve code structure, readability, and maintainability, making future modifications and debugging easier.

Refactor TaskList, Ui, and Storage using Java Streams

Refactored key methods to leverage Java Streams for cleaner and more concise code:

Changes include:

TaskList.find(String keyword)

Replaced manual loop with stream: tasks.stream().filter(task -> task.getTask().contains(keyword)).collect(Collectors.toCollection(ArrayList::new))

Added import: java.util.stream.Collectors

Ui.showTasks(ArrayList<Task> tasks)

Replaced for-loop with IntStream: IntStream.range(0, tasks.size()).forEach(i -> System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + tasks.get(i)))

Added import: java.util.stream.IntStream

Storage.save(ArrayList<Task> tasks)

Replaced for-each loop with stream: tasks.stream().map(Task::toStorageString).forEach(line -> writeLine(fw, line))

Added private helper writeLine(FileWriter fw, String line) that wraps IOException in UncheckedIOException for use in streams

Added import: java.io.UncheckedIOException

These changes simplify iteration, reduce boilerplate, and improve readability by using functional-style constructs.
